@CArmstrongLDN @KateBurkeNHS We get handed down defaults of how family and work need to be divided from such a young age. Starting at the point a woman becomes a mother is far too late.

@KateBurkeNHS @CArmstrongLDN Itâ€™s just starting to be talked about I feel. @cloverstroud talked so openly about the dark violent thoughts that can casually stalk around your mind with your tiny baby at hand. I cried with a self-recognition. More of this pls!

@CArmstrongLDN @KateBurkeNHS The ridiculous thing was I did it to myself. I run my own business. But I feared Iâ€™d lose all my clients and team if I didnâ€™t just pretend like having a baby hadnâ€™t happened and get back â€˜to itâ€™. The biggest battle we have to win is in womenâ€™s own heads.

@KateBurkeNHS @CArmstrongLDN This is such an important topic - the Chinese walls we create between personal and professional contribute enormously to #PND in working women. When I went back to work 4 months post-partum,exclusively breastfeeding (in cupboards) I felt I had to hide any impact of that entirely.

There are client kick off meetings - and there are client KICK OFF meetings. Iâ€™ll leave you to guess which one this was. Needless to say weâ€™re pretty stoked to be working with @Voa1234 and the rest of the @IOCOM12 team. #healthcarePR #techforgood #HealthTech https://t.co/J9b6SuN6PS

@ianmakgill @paulbatterham The only solution I could conjur up was a 1970s â€˜good wallopâ€™ it really would have made me feel better for about 0.7 seconds. So I resisted, gave him a cuddle instead, gritted my teeth and just got out of there pronto.
